metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4008 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server in versions before 21.1.2 and before 1.20.14. An out-of-bounds access can occur in the SProcRenderCompositeGlyphs function. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu2
xorg-server-source - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu2
xserver-common - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu2
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu2
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu2
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu2
xvfb - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:21.1.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs xwayland package contains parts of xorg-server This is ZDI-CAN-14192

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.13-1ubuntu2').
xwayland package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.3-1ubuntu1').
